name: Tune Hotels .com KLIA-LCCT Airport

reviews.title: Tune - Does the trick
reviews.text: As it advertises, Tune hotels include no frills and this delievered as true. I have stayed at various Tune Hotels in Asia and this location boasts the unfriendliest staff. I would recommend booking as far in advance as possible to get the cheapest room rate. This last visit, I had to book the day before and ended up paying close to $70 CAD - a far cry from what it's actually worth and it stung since I have paid as little as $8/night from booking in advance (Tune Hotel Kota Kinabalu). Overall, it's fine for getting a bit of rest before your flight, but there's not much to do in the area, so you wouldn't want to stay here more than one night.

reviews.title: no frills but adequate
reviews.text: We stayed here for two nights, the first after our flight and the second after spending a day at Sunway lagoon. We found the accommodation to be as described in other reviews - small but adequate. The free internet access was a bonus. The location is great as is in walking/viewing distance from the airport and there are enough places to eat near by to get by. I would stay here again if stopping over.

reviews.title: good location , but dirty hotel
reviews.text: The hotel is located very close to the airport - you can reach on foot or pay a ryggit for the bus. Room very small, cramped and dirty. For Internet, TV, air conditioning need to pay extra. Hotel staff very much respect the hour check in and check out. The hotel store, 7 Eleven,''so you can do cheap shopping. I recommend only to people waiting for the plane, because the hotel is not what to do. It is better to go to the heart of Kuala Lumpur.

reviews.title: Perfect for its purpose
reviews.text: Mr. Tune: a genius!!! It's exactly what you want for a place to rest between flights or before early flights. Close to terminal, and you pass a multi-restaurant en route. Excellent bathroom, comfortable bed, aircon (essential to pay for this)with fan excellent. Small, of course: what more do you need? Use it if you are just setting your bags down and showering and sleeping; it makes no claim to be a home-away-from-home. No frills, of course: but it is perfectly comfortable. We slept well: ask for a room high up and on the side away from the road, or on the back side. Only problem would be the slammed doors; maybe the hotel could put a sign on the doors asking people to try to close them carefully. But people in Sheratons are often just as inconsiderate about doors and hallway conversations!

reviews.title: perfect for sleepeing one night
reviews.text: I've been for four diferent nigths this summer and the hotel is very near Low cost airpor, you can see it when you go out fromm the airportt. 5 minutes walking or 1R by van. Very very little but just for sleeping ok. Clean and nice. A little noisy but it's in a very busy place so..... I booked AC in avance and I didn't use it so wait and if you need book there, maybe you can 4$.

reviews.title: stay if just a few hours
reviews.text: Hotel gives the basics. Good shower, firm beds, ok a/c etc. But rooms are tiny, not really cleaned well considering check out is early and check in late, so they should have enough time to clean. Our rooms had scuff marks from suitcases I would assume hitting the walls for lack of space, beddings did not feel too clean and the bathroom had cobwebs. It is ok if you arrive in the afternoon and have to leave early the next day but not for extended stays. Prices are very reasonable if you have your own amenities.

reviews.title: Not Worth It
reviews.text: This hotel (for want of a better name) bares no resemblance at all to a real hotel. The cost is a little bit cheaper than alternatives, but the difference is just not worth it. I spent the night here in transit between air asia flights 108MYR (for room + 12 hours aircon + towel rental).

reviews.title: It's a great hotel for transit passengers
reviews.text: Yes the room is small, reasonably clean except for some rust like stains on the sheets, Air conditioning worked in the second room I tried, but noise level means sleep is impossible. First you have the noise from other rooms, then you have the constant car noise zipping pass the hotel. It feels like the hotel is made of cupboard.

reviews.title: Great for stop over.
reviews.text: Also, if you try to cancel your booking 1 month in advance, you do not get ANY refund. After the removal of an admin fee, the balnce is held in your account which you can ONLY use to purchase a room in a tune hotel and cannot be used for any extras such as Air con, towel, shuttle etc. Your account is open for 6 months and then you loose the money.

reviews.title: A nice bed in a dirty shoebox
reviews.text: Do yourself a favour and spend a little bit more and stay at Empress Sepang Hotel only a 10-15 minute taxi ride away where you will get a good nights sleep.

reviews.title: Great Place
reviews.text: If you need a one night stopover at KL LCCT for connecting flights this hotel is fantastic. Does what it says on the box - literally. 7 min walk from the terminal or transfer bus available at certain times - room is small but clean, filled by a comfy double bed, Great shower. Air con/towels/hairdryer etc are extras - but cheap and worth it. The hotel has a 24 hr 7/11 and a bar/cafe attached - so no matter what time you arrive you can get a snack. Thoroughly recommend!

reviews.title: Never again
reviews.text: N.B Not any use if you plan to go into KL - its an hour on the airport bus there and back

reviews.title: Does what it says
reviews.text: Have stayed in this place at least 5 times due to flights arrival and departures with airasia.

reviews.title: Terrific location, but just for transit
reviews.text: There is NO competition and this is why they dont care, the last room was soooo small that I wonder how it ever passed fire regulations, the entry and bathroom doors didnt even clear the bed, you had to enter sideways and nowhere to keep store any type of bag, room 329. The noise goes all night, bathrooms falling apart, ro0m 339. We have now decided to stop flying with Airasia due to them growing so big that arrival and departures requires waiting lines that compare to Los Angeles airport. Shame as I have been flying with them since 2005.

reviews.title: budget is budget
reviews.text: I stayed at Tune LCCT last month when I had 11 hours between flights and also stayed in similar circumstances on October last year. The place is under 10 minutes walk from the terminal (even with a heavy backpack) and serves it purpose of providing a convenient, cheap and comfortable bed with a hot shower and air-con (extra cost).

reviews.title: Great for transit at KLCC
reviews.text: We stayed one night, and I have to admit that after reading some of the reviews we were a bit worried about what to expect.

reviews.title: Forgot the part where you sleep
reviews.text: Yes, the rooms are small, but we had two cases and we easily fit them in the room and could still get to the bathroom. The aircon was great and didnt hinder us from sleeping.

reviews.title: Good for what it is, try the refresh room for sure.
reviews.text: We had a drink in the courtyard area, and there is a 7/11, cafe for any food you may require.

reviews.title: Perfect for transit passengers
reviews.text: All in all, definitely good value and only took us 5 minutes to walk to the terminal the next morning.

reviews.title: Many ANTS in the rooms!!
reviews.text: It seems ok to put a budget hotel next to a budget terminal. Can live with the lack of service, small rooms etc., but why the poor soundproofing of the room next to a dual carriageway? If the room only fits a bed, why not expect those that book that they also will want toi sleep there?

description: Get a 5-star sleeping experience at a 1-star price with Tune Hotels.com branded limited-service hotels. The KLIA-LCCT Aiport hotel features 222 private rooms with en-suite bathrooms. We believe in letting our guests know exactly what you pay for, and offer the capability to design your stay via reasonably priced pay-as-you-use add-ons. The prices quoted are inclusive of the room price, applicable fees and prevailing taxes only.
